reviewText:
I wish also you could get in the US. A very good movie.
Amy Thayer

Great Movie, I tried for years to get this on dvd and failed then, but now I have managed to get it on dvd  here in London United Kingdom and absolutely love it as I always have.  the film is fantastic and would highly recommend it.
I absolutely loved this when I first saw it on tv years ago. I still love it now and at last I have it on dvd and I can watch it whenever I like.

I so wish I could see this move, however, I cannot bring myself to pay $80+ for it. My friend and I are reading all of the Nora Roberts books in order and this is the next in the list. I so wish I could surprise her with the tape when we see each other next month so if anyone out there can send me a copy please let me know and I will gladly pay to get a copy!
this movie was great. But a hundred and seventeen dollars is to much to spend on a movie especially a vhs. since everybody's getting rid of them

I have seen this movie once and really enjoyed it but now I can't find it on video.  I was wondering if anyone out there has this movie on tape.  If they do then may I please get a copy from you.  I really enjoyed this movie and now want to see it again.  Thank you.

A lovely movie. It is splendidly shot; the camera captures all the moods of the beautiful storyline. It has its greatest asset in Jenny Seagrove, whose exquisite body language complements the delicacy of the script, and has the audience rooted. Competently supported by John Shea, she exudes all feminine grace & passion. After this release, she ought to have been in contention for the sexiest roles in circulation.
